--Rukus--

Rukus's caught Krhinos and Dracon being a conversation, and stands 
slowly from his table, setting his drink aside, and brushing off the 
pleasure bots which were starting to get on his nerves. He almost 
starts a fight with a drunken tech bot, but decides not to cause a 
notable disturbance, or ruckus, so early on the journey.

Sliding smoothly between tables, he avoids a serving bot, and finds 
himself next to Dracon and Krhinos with a shot of energin in his 
hands that he swiped unnoticeably from the serving bot as he passed.

"Krhinos..." he says softly, then nods to Dracon. "I'm Rukus, check 
the roster, I signed on late. When do we leave?"


ooc: 
Sorry, didn't know we'd started posting for this yet, so i missed 
the queue. I'm here now! (as you can see)

Also, the previous landing by Rukus was a *ahem* warmup... yah, 
something like that. So dont bother answering him (not that anyone 
did anyway =p)

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Nic" <Proudwing500k@h...> wrote:
> Krhinos saluted the mercenary and ordered a fusionnaire drink.
> 
> Krhinos: Dracon, pleased to meet you once more. I assume Tycoon
> contacted you for this mission, right?
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "LurkerAbyss" <1641coburn@r...> 
wrote:
> > In the corner, the mercenary Dracon stood alone, not one to be 
part
> of a crowd. He sipped from his glass of energin in hand.  Dracon 
saw
> Krhinos walk into the Mess Hall, and instantly made a gesture by
> tipping his glass forward in a salute.
> > 
> > "G'Day, Captain..." he said solemnly, "how fares our search, 
might I
> ask?"
> >   ----- Original Message ----- 
> >   From: Nic 
> >   To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
> >   Sent: Monday, June 02, 2003 9:33 PM
> >   Subject: The new Contract
> > 
> > 
> >   "Captain Krhinos is requested in room 1000, Captain Krhinos"
> > 
> >   The huge workman entered the elevator and punched a button. It 
took
> >   him straight at the top stair of the huge space station. He
> >   disembarked and walked into the office of Tycoon, his 
entrepreneur
> boss.
> > 
> >   Tycoon: Hi Krhinos. Sit down please. You've got a new mission!
> Energon?
> > 
> >   Krhinos: Just a small glass, you know I'm trying to quit... 
So, what's
> >   the new deal? The Tripredacus again?
> > 
> >   Tycoon: Not this time. (He poured the liquid energon in two 
small
> >   glasses and handed one to his employee.) They've offered great
> >   contracts, but they're ending their invasion soon. They don't 
need any
> >   more ore. (He sipped a little from his cup) This contractor 
wished to
> >   remain anonymous, but it's going to be one of our biggest 
offer yet.
> >   Basically, we have been given the mining rights for a whole 
planet!
> > 
> >   Krhinos nearly choked on his energon. A planet! StarDrill Inc 
would
> >   become the most profitable company in the whole system!
> > 
> >   Krhinos: You serious, Tyke?!? A planet!? Which one just for 
fun?
> > 
> >   Tycoon smiled grimly.
> > 
> >   Tycoon: Earth! We have the rights to mine Earth! The human 
cradle
> >   itself! (Seeing Krhinos's unbelieving face, he held a hand 
up.) Now,
> >   now... It's the prehistoric Earth, not that rebellious 
headquarter of
> >   today's.
> > 
> >   Krhinos: What are we looking for? Iron? Radium?
> > 
> >   Tycoon: All you can find! You get a full mobile mining base 
that you
> >   can keep in orbit, a small outpost on the planet from which 
you can
> >   ship the resources, I'll even grant you that Mammoth Drill you 
love so
> >   much. In short, do your best! Oh... I almost forgot... I got 
you a few
> >   mercenaries to bring along. They should be in the Mess Hall by 
now.
> >   Take 'em along. They'll help you a lot, it's on their 
contract. If it
> >   isn't, just pay them on the company's account.
> > 
> >   Krhinos: Will do, Boss. Thanks a lot! I' make this mission pay 
up!
> > 
> >   The massive bot stood up, finished his drink in a nano and 
saluted
> >   Tycoon one last time before going to the Mess Hall. It was the 
kind of
> >   bar where he'd expect anything, from the lowly pleasure bots 
to the
> >   drunken brawls. He looked around, trying to find some 
relatively fresh
> >   mercs in the crowd...
> >
